newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CRICKET-E.P.SHADE FIRST-DAY HONOURS AGAINST BORDER.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-E.P.SHADE FIRST-DAY HONOURS AGAINST BORDER.

text.p: Tight Eastern Province bowling helped the visitors shade the first-day honours against Border on a two-paced pitch in their four-day Supersport Series cricket match at Buffalo Park on Friday.
Having dismissed the home side for 261 in their first ininngs, E.P. reached six without loss by the close.
Border captain Pieter Strydom won the toss and elected to bat first on a pitch expected to be docile but which turned out to be rather two-paced.
Yet the deciding factors in Border failing to reach 300 were injudicious strokes right down the order from batsmen who had played themselves in, as well as tight bowling by the E.P. attack.
Top score went to Mark Boucher who occupied the crease for two hours and faced 106 balls in compiling a 51 which included five fours.
Seamer Quentin Ferreira was the most successful E.P. bowler with 3-64 but the stranglehold was most effectively applied by West Indian all-rounder Eldine Baptiste who took 2-31 off 21 overs.
The day began with a slice of history when veteran Border batsman Peter Kirsten equalled Clive Rice's record of 164 appearances in South Africa's premier domestic cricket competition.
Bowling: Baptiste 21-7-31-2, Ferreira 16-2-64-3, Shaw 21-5-47-1, Callaghan 7-2-11-2, Love 18-4-35-0, Hayward 20-4-65-2.
To bat: K.Wessels, L.Koen, D.Callaghan, G.Morgan, E.Baptiste, T.Shaw, G.Love, Q.Ferreira, M.Haywood.
Bonus points: Border - three; Eastern Province - four.
